org.osate.ge.businessobjecthandling

Interface BusinessObjectHandler


  • public interface BusinessObjectHandler
    Handles the graphical behavior for a business object. The business object must be contributed using a BusinessObjectProvider
    Since:
    2.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default boolean canCopy(CanCopyContext ctx)
      Returns true if the business object specified in the context can be copied.
      default boolean canDelete(CanDeleteContext ctx)
      Returns true if the business object specified in the context can be deleted.
      default boolean canRename(CanRenameContext ctx)
      Returns true if the business object specified in the context can be renamed.
      CanonicalBusinessObjectReference getCanonicalReference(ReferenceContext ctx)
      Returns a canonical reference for the business object contained in the context.

      Returns the graphical configuration for the specified context.

      Returns an icon to use for the business object specified in the context.

      Gets the name that should be displayed in labels for the business object in the user interface.

      Gets the name of the element that is edited by the user during the renaming process.

    • Method Detail

      • isApplicable

        boolean isApplicable(IsApplicableContext ctx)
        Determines whether a business object handler is applicable based on the specified context. This method should return true if the business object handler handles the business object provided in the context. If this method returns false, no other methods will be executed for the specified business object.
        Parameters:
        ctx - is the context which contains the business object for which the handler is being checked for applicability.
        Returns:
        whether the business object handler is applicable based on the specified context.

      • getCanonicalReference

        CanonicalBusinessObjectReference getCanonicalReference(ReferenceContext ctx)
        Returns a canonical reference for the business object contained in the context.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context containing the business object.
        Returns:
        a canonical reference for the business object contained in the context. Should not return null. Null is currently supported for legacy reasons but new business object handlers should not return null. The lack of a canonical reference will restrict functionality and may result in an error in a future release.

      • getRelativeReference

        RelativeBusinessObjectReference getRelativeReference(ReferenceContext ctx)
        Returns a relative reference for the business object contained in the context.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context containing the business object.
        Returns:
        a relative reference for the business object contained in the context. Must not return null. {@link #isApplicable(IsApplicableContext) should only return true if a relative reference can be generated for the business object.

      • getGraphicalConfiguration

        java.util.Optional<GraphicalConfiguration> getGraphicalConfiguration(GetGraphicalConfigurationContext ctx)
        Returns the graphical configuration for the specified context. An empty optional should only be returned in specialized cases. In most cases a handler should return false in isApplicable(IsApplicableContext) Such cases where an empty optional is appropriate include:
        • A business object handler for an annex library or subclause. This will override the default AADL annex library or subclause behavior and result in a representation of the annex library or subclause not appearing in the diagram.
        • Cases where it is not possible to determine whether the element can be represented graphically during isApplicable(IsApplicableContext). For example: if the appearance of the element depends on the existence of another element.
        Parameters:
        ctx - is the context for which to return the graphical configuration.
        Returns:
        the graphical configuration for the specified context or an empty optional if the business object should not be shown in the diagram.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName(GetNameContext ctx)
        Gets the name that should be displayed in labels for the business object in the user interface. This value is also used in the default implementations of getNameForDiagram(GetNameForDiagramContext) and getNameForRenaming(GetNameContext) A blank string will result in the object and its children not appearing the the outline or configure diagram dialog.
        Parameters:
        ctx - is the context for the request.
        Returns:
        the name that should be displayed for the business object in the user interface. Must not be null.

      • getNameForDiagram

        default java.lang.String getNameForDiagram(GetNameForDiagramContext ctx)
        Returns the name that should be used for the primary label for diagram elements representing the business object in the diagram editor. A blank string will result in the no label being displayed in the diagram editor. Defaults to the value returned by #getNameForUserInterface
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context for the request.
        Returns:
        is the name to be displayed for the business object in the diagram editor. Must not be null.

      • getNameForRenaming

        default java.lang.String getNameForRenaming(GetNameContext ctx)
        Gets the name of the element that is edited by the user during the renaming process. Used as the initial value when the user is editing the name of a business object. Defaults to the value returned by #getNameForUserInterface
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context for the request.
        Returns:
        the name that should be the initial value when a user is editing the name of a business object. Must not be null.

      • getIconId

        default java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> getIconId(GetIconIdContext ctx)
        Returns an icon to use for the business object specified in the context.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context for the request.
        Returns:
        an optional describing the icon used for the command.

      • canRename

        default boolean canRename(CanRenameContext ctx)
        Returns true if the business object specified in the context can be renamed. If this method returns true, the business object should be supported by the graphical editor's the LTK-based rename refactoring or the business object handler must implement the CustomRenamer interface.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context for the request.
        Returns:
        whether the business object can be renamed.

      • validateName

        default java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> validateName(RenameContext ctx)
        Determines whether a proposed name is a valid new name for a business object. If {@link #canRename(CanRenameContext) is implemented, this method should be implemented as well.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context for the request.
        Returns:
        empty if validation succeeds. Otherwise, a validation error to be presented to the user. Must not return null.

      • canDelete

        default boolean canDelete(CanDeleteContext ctx)
        Returns true if the business object specified in the context can be deleted. Deletable business objects must match one of the following criteria:
        • It must be an instance of org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject.
        • It must be an instance of EmfContainerProvider and the business object handler must implement CustomDeleter.
        • The business object handler must implement RawDeleter.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context for the request.
        Returns:
        whether the business object can be deleted.

      • canCopy

        default boolean canCopy(CanCopyContext ctx)
        Returns true if the business object specified in the context can be copied. Copyable business objects must be an instance of org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject.
        Returns:
        whether the business object can be copied.
